  • Job 42
1 Behold, the hope of her is in vain; shall not one be cast down even at the sight of her? 2 None is so fierce that dare stir her up; who then is able to stand before Me? 3 Who hath given Me anything beforehand, that I should repay her? Whatsoever is under the whole heaven is Mine. 4 Would I keep silence concerning her boastings, or her proud talk, or her fair array of words? 5 Who can uncover the face of her garment? Who shall come within her double bridle? 6 Who can open the doors of her face? Round about her teeth is terror. 7 Her scales are her pride, shut up together as with a close seal. 8 One is so near to another, that no air can come between them. 9 They are joined one to another; they stick together, that they cannot be sundered. 10 Her sneezings flash forth light, and her eyes are like the eyelids of the morning. 11 Out of her mouth go burning torches, and sparks of fire leap forth. 12 Out of her nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot and burning rushes. 13 Her breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of her mouth.
14 In her neck abideth strength, and dismay danceth before her. 15 The flakes of her flesh are joined together; they are firm upon her; they cannot be moved. 16 Her heart is as firm as a stone; yea, firm as the nether millstone. 17 When she raiseth herself up, the mighty are afraid; by reason of despair they are beside themselves. 18 If one lay at her with the sword, it will not hold; nor the spear, the dart, nor the pointed shaft. 19 She esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood. 20 The arrow cannot make her flee; slingstones are turned with her into stubble. 21 Clubs are accounted as stubble; she laugheth at the rattling of the javelin. 22 Sharpest potsherds are under her; she spreadeth a threshing-sledge upon the mire. 23 She maketh the deep to boil like a pot; she maketh the sea like a seething mixture. 24 She maketh a path to shine after her; one would think the deep to be hoary. 25 Upon earth there is not her like, who is made to be fearless. 26 She looketh at all high things; she is queen over all the proud beasts.
